field.name: summary
field.value: VS is broken when inspection options are opened from the context action

field.name: description
summary
field.value: Need to Press Esc to open 'Find similar issues' dialog

field.name: description
summary
field.value: Context actions don't work during large SWEA recalculation process

field.name: description
field.value: Perform some significant refactoring (like change signature on some public method) - SWEA will reanalyze files for a while. During that time context actions aren't available.

field.name: summary
field.value: No context for the newly created vb class in asp.net web site until reopened

field.name: description
field.value:
8.0-only bug, for 7.1 all works fine

With solution from attachment:
1) open solution
2) use VS's "add new item", select class, apply and confirm creation of App_Code and placing new file into it

Text editor control opens, you see a blink of highlighter progress, and then nothing of R# is available in this control until you close it and reopen from solution explorer.

nn1.png - before the file is reopened
nn2.png - after the file is reopened

Also may be reproduced using integration test AddNewProjectItemWebSiteVB.AddNewClassWebSiteVBTest.

field.name: summary
field.value: Each error is duplicated 2 times

field.name: description
field.value: check the attachment (VS11)

field.name: summary
field.value: Refactoring.Move in the SolutionExplorer. ProjectStructure is not shown

field.name: summary
field.value: Applied "move to another file" refactoring, got daemon in state "Analysis will start shortly" forever until text control is reopened

field.name: description
field.value:
In Class19.cs, apply "move to another file" refactoring to "class @class".

After that, text control is opened, and daemon is in state "Analysis will start shortly" forever.
Only if I switch to another text control, or close-reopen, it continues.
It I undo the change, daemon is again in that state forever.

There also exists corresponding integration tests failure.

field.name: summary
field.value: Bad formatting of XML comments in default

field.name: description
summary
field.value: Regression for RSRP-228400 Excluding files from project doesn't remove their tests from the system

field.name: description
field.value:
Again, tests are not removed if file is excluded from solution. On next run, they are red-overlined.

Also, the user cannot even close the session or delete the tests - this elements are disabled for such red-overlined tests.

field.name: summary
field.value: "Move type to another namespace" namespace suggestion popup is blank in 8.0

field.name: description
field.value:
In 7.1, this list showed available namespaces.
In 8.0, this list is blank.

field.name: summary
field.value: xaml completion is broken in vs10

field.name: description
field.value: subj

field.name: summary
field.value: ValidateAssemblyReferencesResolved is red

field.name: description
field.value: ReSharper solution -> ValidateAssemblyReferencesResolved -> red code there

field.name: summary
field.value: Node states are not always synchronized on test finish

field.name: description
field.value:
Even if test run has finished, top-level nodes may be left forever in "Running" state.

Project is attached.

field.name: summary
field.value: Test run for WinRT tests is not synchronized with app deployment

field.name: description
field.value:
Run unit tests several times, see that VS error list is filled with one more message each time.

To reproduce the exception, first launch debug via VS's test runner, and then run tests from R#.

field.name: summary
field.value: If I got exception during debug using R#'s runner and Continue, I'm suddenly directed to some metro-window clicking through which I got to metro-desktop

field.name: description
field.value:
No such issue with VS's runner, only with R#'s.

1) start debug
2) VS will break on exception
3) continue debug

You'll be surprised to see a violet blank window of some metro-app.
If you click over it, you'll see the metro-desktop.

When using VS's runner, executing Continue simply brings me back to VS.

field.name: summary
field.value: If I run mstest category for tests located in different assemblies, tests from second assembly are marked as inconclusive

field.name: description
field.value: Subj.

field.name: summary
field.value: False "Assembly name expected instead of project name"

field.name: description
field.value:
Project:
http://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/WinRTAssemblyPathReference.7z?file=74-104884&v=0&c=true

Issue appeared after your merge, so.

field.name: summary
field.value: "Executor process exited" while running msfakes test

field.name: description
field.value: Subj.

field.name: summary
field.value: Bogus 'The type arguments for method cannot be inferred from usage. Try specifying the type arguments explicitly.'

field.name: description
summary
field.value: "Remove unused references" removes references which are used by generated files from Silverlight projects, leading to uncompilable code

field.name: description
field.value:
Create Silverlight cs or vb project, invoke "refactor this" -> "remove unused references" on solution.
Try to compile project => fail.

p.s.: I did not find such issue in youtrack, but if this is known old-school issue, plz lower the priority.

field.name: summary
field.value: Multipublic in vb.net autopopup

field.name: description
field.value:
subj

Just create new vb.net project and type "Pu" inside class. You'll see 2 "public"'s in autopopup list. If you erase "u", type "u" again, and repeat this N times, you'll get N more "public"'s in list.

field.name: summary
field.value: QuickFixes and bracket matching stop working after being invoked first time for a while

field.name: description
field.value:
Apply any QuickFix in text control.

After that and until some time elapsed or until typing in text control, QuickFixes and brackets highlighting are unavailable at all.

field.name: summary
field.value: Test run termination does not always terminate satellite runner process - it may continue to run tests

field.name: description
field.value:
Add several integration tests from different namespaces to test session, and do "run all".
Wait for several tests to pass, then terminate session.

There is a chance that satellite process still will be running, and test execution won't stop at all.

Reproduced it twice locally, after it was first noticed by Coox.

field.name: summary
field.value: vb basic completion shows different completions before and after Esc, and the second of them misbehaves

field.name: description
field.value:
The easiest repro invokes auto-completion first, basic second.

1) open DefaultVB.aspx.vb from attached project
2) after line Dim i As Integer type at new line:
{code}
Dim cont As M{caret}
{code}

(if you'll catch RSRP-338565, just kill VS and retry)

3) wait for auto-completion, dissolve it using Esc
4) invoke basic-completion, see that no items in it are pre-selected, and if you invoke some of its items, part of word that you typed is not erased, and the whole word is appended to it, which is wrong behavior


The harder case invoked two basic-completions.
After invoking first basic completion, you have normal completion list.
After pressing Esc and invoking completion second time, you have misbehaved completion list.

field.name: summary
field.value: css/aspx/javascript/html/xml second completion misbehaves as in RSRP-338566

field.name: description
field.value:
Type "col" in CSS and try to complete.

First completion: you get "color: " with Tab, Enter or Space.
Second completion: you get "colcolor: " with Tab, Enter or Space.

Maybe double-completion should be switched off for them as it was for xaml?

field.name: summary
field.value: Bulbs inconsistent behavior

field.name: description
field.value:
1) apply QF that removes error => bulb is still present ?!
2) apply QF again => it fixes non-existing problem
3) undo both fixes, and bulb now does not show error until user moves caret left-right

field.name: summary
field.value: Tests do not run correctly on freshly created mstest project: infinite run, strikethrough tests in sessions window

field.name: description
field.value:
1) create new mstest project in VS11
2) run test
3) VS hangs for a while (alike RSRP-338481)
4) then it is alive, but test execution runs infinitely, and test is displayed as strikethrough in sessions window
5) after I stop run and close tab, I get RSRP-338763

field.name: summary
field.value: "Advanced" button in "Generate event subscription" for XAML silently closes the dialog

field.name: description
field.value:
Set caret on Grid, invoke "Generate", select "Event subscriptions", in dialog check any of them and click "Advanced" button.

Dialog silently closes: no exception, no clear reason why it did so.

field.name: summary
field.value: CompletionAspCSharpVbCssJsTest permanently leads to VS hang

field.name: description
field.value:
There is no concrete single test to reproduce issue, but if you run the whole fixture, at some moment VS will hang.
I was not able to run the whole fixture without hangs.

Please take a look.
Seems that it is still in brackets matching subsystem. If not, plz reassign to appropriate developer.

field.name: summary
field.value: Javascript tests are broken in 8.0

field.name: description
field.value: Test are in never-ending pending state.

field.name: summary
field.value: ReSharper 7.1 EAP shows "No parameterless constructor defined for this object" for Asp.NET MVC action parameters of collections defined as interfaces (IEnumerable`1, IDictionary`2, etc)

field.name: description
summary
field.value: ReSharper 7.1 EAP shows "No parameterless constructor defined for this object" for Asp.NET MVC action parameters that have model binder defined

field.name: description
summary
field.value: GotoEvr search results after writing and deleting several symbols are completely different

field.name: description
field.value:
repro
1. open solution in vs11
2. call gototevr
3. write Prog - see lots of results from framework
4. write Program - see my class Program and some results from the framework
4. delete "ram" to Prog - see only my class program
expected - same results as in (3).

field.name: summary
field.value: Go to next error works only in the scope of the current file when SWEA is paused

field.name: description
field.value:
Turn on SWEA -> collect some errors in different files -> pause analysis -> 

try to navigate through the error list - you will be able to do that just in the scope of file

field.name: summary
field.value: Disallow the debug of javascript unit tests from any place

field.name: description
field.value:
Now it is possible to launch js-tests debug from solution explorer.

This leads to exception in test runner.

field.name: summary
field.value: Jasmine asynchronous tests are inconclusive every second-third run when they are run in browser, and sometimes are hung when run in phantomjs

field.name: description
field.value:
http://pivotal.github.com/jasmine/#section-Asynchronous_Support

For some runs:
{code}
<JSTestWeb> (1 test), Success
  Asynchronous specs (1 test), Success
    should support async execution of test preparation and exepectations, Success
{code}

For some runs:
{code}
<JSTestWeb> (1 test), 
  Asynchronous specs (1 test), 
    should support async execution of test preparation and exepectations, Inconclusive: Test wasn't run
{code}

Please check what could be wrong with this.

As for run with phantomjs, sometimes this leads to forever-running tests, and phantomjs left running even after I stop the tests run.

field.name: summary
field.value: QUnit run is always inconclusive if QUnit.done is specified

field.name: description
summary
field.value: "Evaluation ended" license dialog is shown in endless loop if at least one day passed since it has appeared and product has expired

field.name: description
field.value:
I left R# evaluation that had to expire on Friday or Saturday (don't remember exactly) running in VM.

When I returned today (next week Monday since dialog has appeared), I saw license dialog depicted on screenshot.

It is shown in endless loop when I am clicking OK.

Also, it always shows that "1 day left", but "evaluation period has expired".

Seems that some counters are not synchronized within this dialog, and part of it thinks it's still Friday, but the other part knows that today is next week Monday, so it rejects the attempt to continue evaluation.

field.name: summary
field.value: Duplicate items in xaml basic completion

field.name: description
field.value:
Very strange thing, and I was happy to see this only once, after invoking different kinds of completion one by one when trying to reproduce RSRP-337339.

Solution is the same:
http://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/WpfApp.7z?file=74-105321&v=0&c=true

field.name: summary
field.value: UnitTesting should clean-up test runner processes on abort

field.name: description
summary
field.value: "Strait" completion does not work in 8.0: if only one item is available in completion, it is not inserted automatically

field.name: description
field.value:
In 7.1, if there is only one completion item, it was inserted automatically when user invokes completion command.

In 8.0, if there is only one completion item, lookup window is shown with only one item.

It this is a planned change of behavior, plz comment and re-assign to me to fix corresponding tests.

summary
field.value: "Find usages advanced" finds not all usages in referenced assemblies in 8.0

field.name: description
field.value:
Try to "find usages advanced" of UserControl in Class1.cs of attached solution.

Options: Find - only "Derived types", Scope - "Solution and libraries"

7.1.1 finds usages in 3 referenced assemblies

8.0 finds usages only in 1 referenced assembly

Though, usage of UsageControl really exists in System.Web.Mobile.

Both in autopopup and basic-completion.
Four suggestions instead of two.

field.name: summary
field.value: Unit test explorer grouping by categories heavily depends on currently opened text control

field.name: description
field.value:
If open solution where text control with NUnit tests is opened, UTE says that all tests are uncategorized.
If I switch control to control with MSTest tests and refresh, UTE says that there is only one categorized test.
Also, R# cannot see NUnit category at all in such a case (even no item in gutter icon menu).

If I now save-reload solution (control with MSTest tests is focused), UTE says that there is only one categorized test.
If I switch control to control with NUnit tests and refresh, UTE says that there are two categorized tests.

Something is wrong in the state of unittesting.

field.name: description
field.value: If I click "Show in Find Results", it does nothing, only closes search window.

field.name: summary
field.value: visual basic's internal property representation should not be present in second completion

field.name: description
field.value:
{code:lang=vb}
Class Family
  Property Daughters As New List(Of String) From {"Beth", "Diane"}
  Property Sons As New List(Of String) From {"Abe", "Carl"}
  Public ReadOnly Iterator Property Children As IEnumerable(Of String)
    Get
      For Each name As String In Daughter{caret} : Yield name : Next
      For Each name As String In Sons : Yield name : Next
    End Get
  End Property
End Class
Module Module1
  Sub Main()
    Dim x As New Family
    For Each c As String In x.Children
      Console.WriteLine(c) ' prints Beth, Diane, Abe, Carl
    Next
  End Sub
End Module
{code}

field.name: summary
field.value: In vb.net xmldoc erasing symbol from tag name leads to VS's intellisense suggest appear alongside R#'s

field.name: summary
field.value: Setup and cleanup scripts from testsettings no longer work

field.name: description
field.value:
Setup & cleanup scripts specified in testsettings do not run if tests are launched via R#.
They do run, if via VS's runner.

field.name: summary
field.value: Endless disposal of unit tests session when running debug for both mstest and nunit - vs "is busy" on solution closing

field.name: description
field.value:
Steps to reproduce:
1) open solution from attachment
2) invoke "debug unit tests" for solution in solution explorer
3) select only NUnitTestProject1 and UnitTestProject1
4) invoke "debug" for them
5) see that UnitTestProject1 is in pending state endlessly
6) terminate test execution, close session
7) try to close solution

VS will be in "VS is busy" state, seems that forever.

field.name: summary
field.value: mstest tests terminated while deploying are not really stopped and continue execution

field.name: description
field.value:
Use solution from attachment.

Specify in testsettings big file for deployment (I used 1Gb part of vmware disk image).
Set testsettings file in R#'s options.

Run test TestMethod125, then stop and terminate it.
You'll see that:
1) unit test session will display question marks near tests
2) mstest executor is still in process and doing something (seems that it continues to run the test)
3) after mstest executor finishes, unit test session will display green "passed" marks near tests, and the string that test outputs will be displayed there in test output

So, it seems that if test is terminated while it is deploying files, it is not really stopped and continues to run in background.

field.name: summary
field.value: Duplicates in vb.net completion

field.name: description
summary
field.value: code cleanup where you ONLY select "optimise 'using' directives" also changes names of attribute usages.

field.name: description
field.value: in version 5,6, and 7 of resharper, optimise usings also changes attribute usage names. It shortens the name (leaves out the "Attribute" part). But this is not what I want. I only want to optimise the using part.

field.name: summary
field.value: False conflict on renaming type when type with different number of generic parameters exist

field.name: description
summary
field.value: VB: duplicate items in completion when using namespace type import

field.name: description
field.value:
{code}
Imports EmbeddedXmlTest.Colors55

Public Enum Colors55
  Red
  Reddy
  Reddest
  Green
  Blue
End Enum

Public Class Ttt
  Public Shared A As Integer = 5
End Class

Module M1
  Sub Main()
    Dim c As Colors55 = Re{caret}
  End Sub
End Module
{code}

Call completion and type "d", see duplicated is list.

field.name: summary
field.value: Removing non-used local variable leads to improper highlighting on statement

field.name: description
summary
field.value: "Convert interface to abstract class" should properly reorder inherited members list

field.name: description
summary
field.value: "Convert interface to abstract class" should not mark abstract inherited method as "override", should use "abstract override" instead

field.name: description
summary
field.value: 'Create type' XAML quick fix creates uncompilable code in WinRT, because UIElement defined in Windows.winmd has no constructors

field.name: description
field.value:
Just create WinRT app, type some non-existing object tag, and apply QF 'Create type'.

New type will be derived from UIElement which is not correct for WinRT.

See also: http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/winappswithcsharp/thread/422af01a-2b48-4815-963b-0b5e21e68260/

Quote: "It would be better to derive from Control (or others) than the base UIElement. I'll look into this, but that would be my recommendation". He also confirms the same for Silverlight.

field.name: summary
field.value: 'The property "Text" cannot be empty' after converting empty-valued Text attribute to nested element

field.name: description
summary
field.value: QuickDoc unpin/close buttons work from second/third attempt if several pinned windows are opened

field.name: description
field.value:
Steps to reproduce:
1) open three QuickDoc windows, moving each of them after opening - they will be pinned
2) now try to close or unpin each of the windows - you'll be able to do it only at the second or even the third attempt

field.name: summary
field.value: If default xaml namespace is renamed, R# shows errors in code, though project compiles and starts fine

field.name: description
summary
field.value: "Move to resource" refactoring should not be applicable to xaml event handlers (or at least, properly handle this with error message)

field.name: description
field.value:
Now this refactoring is available and the resx tool throws exception.
Should either properly process this, or not show this refactoring at all for xaml event handlers.

field.name: summary
field.value: Do not suggest to add something to resources if this something is not serializable - this behavior breaks resource editor and forces user to manually edit resources xml

field.name: description
field.value:
For example, in XAML document I was able to move System.Windows.Media.Color object to resources.

After that, VS resource editor cannot be opened normally.
Only after removing wrong entry from resource file xml manually, I was able to open resource editor gui.

Seems that R#'s resource tool needs to perform additional check for type to be serializable before adding resource entry.

field.name: summary
field.value: Do not suggest to convert "Name" to property element syntax

field.name: description
field.value:
Case A:

{code}
<Button Name="bbb">
</Button>
{code}

All R# features work fine, project compiles fine, works fine.


Case B:

{code}
<Button>
  <Button.Name>bbb</Button.Name>
</Button>
{code}

R# does not recognize item "bbb" at all, project compiles with warning "Field 'WpfApplication5.MainWindow.bbb' is never assigned to, and will always have its default value null", starts and fails with NullReferenceException.

It seems to be a bug or undocumented implementation issue in WPF itself. Maybe it should be reported to ms connect, at least they may update documentation to take this into account.

From R#'s side, it will be nice to turn off "Convert attribute to nested element" for Name attribute, because it leads to errors.

field.name: summary
field.value: After renaming test method, first test run gives <?> for every variant of parameterized test

field.name: description
summary
field.value: Test tracking suddenly disables if I traverse unit test session tree while tests are running

field.name: description
summary
field.value: Creating resource in Binding is impossible

field.name: description
field.value:
{code}
    <Grid>        
        <Button>
            <Button.Content>
                <Binding>
                    <Binding.Source>
                        <StaticResource ResourceKey="aaa" />
                    </Binding.Source>
                </Binding>
            </Button.Content>
        </Button>
    </Grid>
{code}

Called QF for "aaa".

In QF list, I see "create resource in parent element <Binding>". Binding is not descendant of FrameworkElement, so this leads to erroneous markup.

This QF should be smarter and should find the nearest parent which is FrameworkElement.

field.name: summary
field.value: Escape sequences in XAML markup extensions are not always processed correctly

field.name: description
field.value:
{code}
    <Grid>
        <Grid.Resources>
            <ResourceDictionary>
                <system:String x:Key="a1">aaa</system:String>
            </ResourceDictionary>
        </Grid.Resources>
        
        <Button Content="{StaticResource "a1"}">            
        </Button>
    </Grid>
{code}

VS recognizes such sequences and resolves resources.
R# fails on that.

field.name: summary
field.value: "Create XAML type" in vb.net silverlight xaml leads to uncompilable code

field.name: description
field.value:
Just create vb.net silverlight project, type non-existing tag and use QF "Create XAML type".
Resulting code in uncompilable. No such problem in C# silverlight project.

field.name: summary
field.value: WP8: after specifying DataContext using R#'s suggestion, text is gone from preview

field.name: description
field.value:
1) create default winphone 8 panorama app
2) R# says that it cannot resolve item specified in binding
3) apply R#'s QF to specify context type
4) in suggestions list, select the only available item (and it seems to be correct)
5) after applying QF you'll see that headers are gone from preview; if you revert QF - headers will come back

Something is wrong with binding resolution, though I don't know, what specifically.

field.name: summary
field.value: Static members and fieldnames should not be suggested after "new"

field.name: description
summary
field.value: Seems that completion should not include the same thing only differing by module name in list

field.name: description
field.value:
F2 and TestXXX.F2 in list on screenshot are the same thing.
Seems that one of them should have been filtered out.

{code:lang=vb}
Module TestXXX
    WithEvents x As Raiser

    Sub E1Handler() Handles x.E1
        Console.WriteLine("Raised")
    End Sub

    ReadOnly Property F2(i As Integer) As Integer
        Get
            If i = 0 Then
                F2 = 1    ' Sets the return value.
            Else
                F2 = F2(i - 1) ' Recursive call.
            End If
        End Get
    End Property


    Sub Main()
        x = New Raiser()
        x.Raise()
        x.Raise()
    End Sub
End Module
{code}

field.name: summary
field.value: Import completion in WPF XAML inserts invalid namespace name for user control from another project in the same solution

field.name: description
field.value:
In MainWindow.xaml inside grid:
1) type "<usercontrol1"
2) invoke import-completion
3) choose UserControl1 (in WpfControlLibrary1)

R# highlights both tag and namespace name as wrong.
Solution cannot be built.

If I remove ".dll" from namespace name, solution compiles fine.

Seems that assembly file name extension is improper for type from another project in the same solution

field.name: summary
field.value: Recent fix for "navigate to recent edits" introduced duplicate items without disambiguation in list, and for some types items are still merged

field.name: description
field.value:
1) duplicate items without disambiguation in list are for: aspx, Web.config
2) items are still merged for: vb, app.config

for example, in integration test TestNavigateToRecentEdits we now have the following list:
{code}
            "JQueryUsageExample.aspx",
            "JQueryUsageExample.aspx",
            "TestWithExpression.cs",
            "Test      in TestWithExpression.cs",
            "Web.config",
            "Web.config",
            "app.config",
            "CSSTest.aspx",
            "CSSTest.aspx",
            "hz26Test      in TestClass.vb",
            "GetHumanhz0      in Human.cs",
            "hzName      in Human.cs"
{code}
(will push this test in 5 minutes)
